## **Description**
The **Case **operator allows to modify the characters of an input string in upper or lower case, based on the configuration settings.

## **Input**
**Input**

**Data type**

**Description**

**in0**

String

The string that you want to modify

## **Output**
**Output**

**Data type**

**Description**

**out0**

String

The modified string

## **![](data:image/png;base64,)****Settings**
- From the **Case **drop-down menu, select the type of modification that you want to apply to the input string. The available options are:

**Lower Case**: Convert all characters to lower case.

- **Upper Case**: Convert all characters to upper case.

- **Camel Case**: Convert the first character of the string to upper case.

- **First Case**: Convert the first character of the string to lower case.

- Click **Apply **to confirm.

## **Special cases**
In special cases, the operator behaves as follows:

**Case**

**Behavior**

**NULL input (no input)**

The operator considers a NULL input as an empty string. The system logs a warning event.

**Input with NULL value**

The operator considers an input with NULL value as an empty string. The system logs a warning event.
